intro: Euphorbia corollata var. grandiflora, commonly known as the showy spurge, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and prairies, preferring well-drained soils. Its showy, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in cyathia, which are modified leaf-like structures. The plant is drought-tolerant and often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value.
